taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in deep, open pools and channels of turbid, lowland rivers; small lakes and impoundments (Ref. 5723, 10294).  Feeds on surface and aquatic insects, crustaceans, mollusks, small fishes, frogs, shrew, and mice (Ref. 10294).  Migrates upstream in the spring to spawn and feed.  Moves downstream in the fall.  Mainly nocturnal.  Preyed upon by birds, some mammals, and other fishes.  Marketed smoked.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  western Ontario to the Mackenzie River as far down as Aklavik.  In the east, it extends southwest below the Great Lakes, through the Ohio and Mississippi River drainages.  In the, west it occurs southeast from western Alberta, through eastern Montana and Wyoming, to Oklahoma.
dataObjects.references: Scott, W.B. and E.J. Crossman 1973 Freshwater fishes of Canada. Bull. Fish. Res. Board Can. 184:1-966. (Ref. 1998)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.description: Potamodromous. Migrating within streams, migratory in rivers, e.g. Saliminus, Moxostoma, Labeo.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Taxonomy
dataObjects.description: Comments: One of two species in a monogeneric family. Hiodon is the only extant North American member of the order Osteoglossiformes. Formerly included in the genus Amphiodon.
